column6: Not the “original” shade I was searching for
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
column14: I have been looking for the original chestnut rose Lolita shade from before they changed it maybe a couple years ago, and I thought this was it, since it says it’s “original” and is so pricey, but sadly it’s not. This has a more purplish tone, and not the soft, chestnut rose coloring of the original which made it my favorite shade ever. I’m sure this is the perfect shade for some, but not for me. I’ll definitely be more careful when shopping. I shared the difference in coloring between the old and the new. In the second photo, the lower shade is the original Lolita I was looking for, and the top is this shade.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
column14: I love it!!! I am very sensitive to may lipsticks or lip glass practically everything makes my lips peel. This leave my lips feeling smooth I apply a little or later it a couple times if I want to go darker either way looks amazing!! Defiantly buying a back up. With my luck when I find something I absolutely love it’s ends up being discontinued!! So I tend to stock up on things I love!!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
column14: I am over the moon for Kat von D studded lipstick.  The texture is rich  and smooth.  It goes on and stays on.  I think it has a bit of long lasting stain as my lips look beautiful even by midday after several cups of coffee.  It has a delicious, subtle flavor and scent that is fruit and floral based.  I’ve bought other colors as well.  This one is a beautiful subtle red that will work with any skin tone.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
column14: It's the perfect mix of velvet and creamy.  It's not sticky or dry.  Stays on for a long time.  Favorite colors are Lolita and Cathedral.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2020
column14: The color is so pretty. Like an amped up natural lip color for me (fairly light skin). I love that a little goes a long way, but you can get a darker color if you use more. I get why it's expensive. It'll take me a long time to use it since I like applying it lightly. It's almost like a stain and not sticky or creamy, which I like.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2015
column14: I've been hearing about this lipstick forever, so I FINALLY decided to see what all the fuss was about - albeit not expecting much, since my super fair skin rejects 95% of lipstick shades I try. Well...I immediately see what all the hype is about. The shade is darker than I was expecting, but so so flattering. It's very well pigmented with a great matte finish, but it's still creamy (and not drying, like a lot of matte lipsticks). This is my new go-to lip color!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
column14: Unfortunately I received Lolita II (not the original Lolita, which I’ve had before). I’m not going to deal with the hassle of a return; the color is Ok (I loved my original Lolita and was buying a replacement), but it isn’t the same. The listing should be changed.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2021
column14: Nice color. Stays well. Not drying. I have sensitive, dry skin so generally skeptical about products but this was easy to apply and gentle on my lips. Would recommend.
